intro: Amphorkis laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered amphorkis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
